FuncDef:
The user-queue qos-profile time-range command configures scheduling parameters for user queues in the QoS profile time-range view.
The undo user-queue qos-profile time-range command cancels the configuration.
By default, no scheduling parameters are configured for user queues in the QoS profile time-range view.
CLIs: user-queue cir <cir-value> [ cbs <cbs-value> ] [ [ pir <pir-value> [ pbs <pbs-value> ] [ pir-priority high ] ] | [ flow-queue <flow-queue-name> ] | [ flow-mapping <mapping-name> ] | [ user-group-queue <user-group-name> ] ] [ inbound | outbound ] [ service-template <template-name> [ adjust-on-card ] ] [ time-range <time-range-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the CBS.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4194304, in bytes. By default, the value complies with the following formula: cbs-value (byte) = cir-value (kbit/s) x 10 (ms)/8.

Indicates the PIR. It must be smaller than or equal to the bandwidth of the interface.
The value can be 0 or an integer ranging from 16 to 4294967294, in kbit/s. The value of pir-value must be smaller than or equal to the interface bandwidth. The minimum value of the PIR can be set to the specified value of the CIR.
When pir pir-value is not configured, the default value of pir-value is equal to cir-value.

Indicates the PBS.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4194304, in bytes. By default, the value complies with the following formula: pbs-value (byte) = pir-value (kbit/s)*10 (ms) / 8.

Indicates the flow queue profile.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates the flow queue mapping object.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates the name of the user group queue.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates the service profile name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Enable the packet length adjust on card.
-

Indicates the time-range profile name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates the CIR. It must be smaller than or equal to the bandwidth of the interface.
The value can be 0 or an integer ranging from 16 to 4294967294, in kbit/s.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-qos-profile-p1-time-range] user-queue cir 200 pir 600 flow-queue test flow-mapping test user-group-queue test service-template test1 time-range a
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is used to configure HQoS user queue scheduling parameters in a QoS profile time range. After the qos-profile time-range configuration is applied to an interface, HQoS configurations take effect on the interface.
Prerequisites
A qos profile time range is created.
The flow queue mapping object, flow queue profile, and GQ used in the command must have been created before application and properly configured.
Follow-up Procedure
Apply the qos-profile time-range to an interface.
Precautions
In this command, the user group queue must be of the global type rather than slot-based.
This command and the car command in the interface view are mutually exclusive. That is, the two commands cannot be both configured.
If uni-directional user queue scheduling (on either incoming traffic or outgoing traffic) is already configured, you cannot configure user queue scheduling without specifying the traffic direction. Conversely, if directionless user queue scheduling is already configured, you cannot configure uni-directional user queue scheduling.
This command can be configured only in the qos-profile time-range view.
One in the QoS profile time-range view has 2 user-queue configurations with time-range and one user-queue configuration without time-range. These user-queue configurations take effect based on the specific time-range value. After all the time-range values carried in the user-queue configurations expire, the user-queue configuration without time-range starts to take effect. Within the same time range, the user queue configuration with time-range takes precedence over the user-queue configuration without time-range.
